            </gmd:citation>
            <gmd:abstract>
                <gco:CharacterString>LakeKeepers aims to address the gaps in lake water quality data that exist in many parts of Alberta. Current monitoring strategies restrict much of the Provincial data to lakes within easy driving distance from Edmonton or Calgary – however, many of Alberta’s invaluable water resources exist outside of this range and as a result have little water quality data. Current monitoring strategies for the ice-on period through the winter months are also limited. Citizen scientists collect information such as water clarity, chlorophyll-a, total Kjeldahl Nitrogen, total Phosphorus, microcystin concentrations, water temperature, dissolved oxygen, and some other water quality parameters. Information is also collected through the year, with monitoring occurring in both the summer and winter months. While the focus of the summer sampling is to gather baseline water quality information, the winter sampling is focused towards collecting parameters that best represent fish habitat quality, since ice anglers are the primary citizen scientists in the winter months.</gco:CharacterString>
            </gmd:abstract>

                codeListValue="onGoing">onGoing</gmd:MD_ProgressCode>

name: 10-25976-2eh8-7s91
notes: LakeKeepers aims to address the gaps in lake water quality data that exist in many parts of Alberta. Current monitoring strategies restrict much of the Provincial data to lakes within easy driving distance from Edmonton or Calgary – however, many of Alberta’s invaluable water resources exist outside of this range and as a result have little water quality data. Current monitoring strategies for the ice-on period through the winter months are also limited. Citizen scientists collect information such as water clarity, chlorophyll-a, total Kjeldahl Nitrogen, total Phosphorus, microcystin concentrations, water temperature, dissolved oxygen, and some other water quality parameters. Information is also collected through the year, with monitoring occurring in both the summer and winter months. While the focus of the summer sampling is to gather baseline water quality information, the winter sampling is focused towards collecting parameters that best represent fish habitat quality, since ice anglers are the primary citizen scientists in the winter months.

notes_translated.en: LakeKeepers aims to address the gaps in lake water quality data that exist in many parts of Alberta. Current monitoring strategies restrict much of the Provincial data to lakes within easy driving distance from Edmonton or Calgary – however, many of Alberta’s invaluable water resources exist outside of this range and as a result have little water quality data. Current monitoring strategies for the ice-on period through the winter months are also limited. Citizen scientists collect information such as water clarity, chlorophyll-a, total Kjeldahl Nitrogen, total Phosphorus, microcystin concentrations, water temperature, dissolved oxygen, and some other water quality parameters. Information is also collected through the year, with monitoring occurring in both the summer and winter months. While the focus of the summer sampling is to gather baseline water quality information, the winter sampling is focused towards collecting parameters that best represent fish habitat quality, since ice anglers are the primary citizen scientists in the winter months.
notes_translated.fr: LakeKeepers vise à combler les lacunes dans les données sur la qualité de l'eau des lacs qui existent dans de nombreuses régions de l'Alberta. Les stratégies de surveillance actuelles limitent la plupart des données provinciales aux lacs facilement accessibles en voiture d'Edmonton ou de Calgary. Cependant, de nombreuses ressources en eau inestimables de l'Alberta se situent en dehors de cette fourchette et ne disposent donc que de peu de données sur la qualité de l'eau. Les stratégies de surveillance actuelles pour la période glaciaire pendant les mois d'hiver sont également limitées. Les scientifiques citoyens collectent des informations telles que la clarté de l'eau, la chlorophylle-a, l'azote Kjeldahl total, le phosphore total, les concentrations de microcystine, la température de l'eau, l'oxygène dissous et certains autres paramètres de qualité de l'eau. Des informations sont également recueillies tout au long de l'année, la surveillance ayant lieu à la fois en été et en hiver. Alors que l'échantillonnage estival vise à recueillir des informations de référence sur la qualité de l'eau, l'échantillonnage hivernal est axé sur la collecte des paramètres qui représentent le mieux la qualité de l'habitat du poisson, étant donné que les pêcheurs sur glace sont les principaux scientifiques citoyens pendant les mois d'hiver.

notes_translation_method.fr: Description text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

description_translated.en: DataStream is an open access platform for sharing water and sediment quality data.
description_translated.fr: DataStream est une plateforme en libre accès pour partager des données sur la qualité de l'eau et des sédiments.

title: LakeKeepers Water Quality Data

title_translated.fr: Données sur la qualité de l'eau de LakeKeepers
